original: 7.2.4.1. Anulomapuggala🔽Yo kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yo vā pana paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti so kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.

analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to lust for existence … the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti, no
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti iti  dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti no
translated: Or alternatively, when he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires?

original: ca tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato vicikicchānusayañca🔽parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca 🔽parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance in painful feeling, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he does not thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires. But when he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance in the two kinds of feeling in the sensual-desire element, he does so thereby.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no  yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: From the abandoning of the lust for sensual desires, the lust for existence is abandoned.🔽From the abandoning of the lust for existence, the lust for sensual desires is abandoned.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato🔽kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca parijānāti
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā  yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti iti  dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas  kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas avijja anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: From the abandoning of the lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to ignorance is abandoned.🔽From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to ignorance, the lust for sensual desires is abandoned.🔽From the abandoning of the lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to ignorance is abandoned.

original: kāmarāgānusayañca parijānāti.🔽Yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam ca parijānāti  yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to ignorance, the lust for sensual desires is abandoned.🔽From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit is abandoned.

original: Yato vā pana mānānusayaṁ parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yatas vā pana māna anusayam parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to resentment is abandoned.

original: Yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to resistance, has one then fully understood the underlying tendency to view … the underlying tendency to doubt?

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or when one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt, has one then fully understood the underlying tendency to resistance?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti,
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming,

original: no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca
translated: one has not yet fully understood the underlying tendency to resistance there. But when one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt in painful feeling,

original: parijānāti paṭighānusayañca parijānāti.🔽Yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: parijānāti paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti  yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: one has also fully understood the underlying tendency to resistance there.🔽When one fully understands the underlying tendency to resistance, has one then fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for existence?

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Or when one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for existence, has one then fully understood the underlying tendency to resistance?

original: Yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti tatas avijja anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to resistance, has one then fully understood the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or when one fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, has one then fully understood the underlying tendency to resistance?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti,
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance,

original: no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca parijānāti
analyzed: no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment. In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance

original: paṭighānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: and the underlying tendency to resentment.

original: Yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas māna anusayam parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty? He does.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or when he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas māna anusayam parijānāti
translated: In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: mānānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas māna anusayam parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu tatas māna anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas bhava rāga anusaya
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, but not the underlying tendency to lust for being.

original: parijānāti. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato mānānusayañca parijānāti bhavarāgānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas māna anusayam ca parijānāti bhava rāga anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements he abandons both the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for being.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or alternatively, when he abandons the underlying tendency to lust for being, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas māna anusayam parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or alternatively, when he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti.🔽Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayañca parijānāti
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas māna anusayam parijānāti  kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas avijja anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, but not the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: mānānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements he abandons both the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yato diṭṭhānusayaṁ parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas diṭṭha anusayam parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to false view, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to uncertainty?

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā pe
translated: Or from the abandoning of the fetter of uncertainty does he abandon the fetter of views? He abandons it.

original: Yato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ
analyzed: yatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti  tīsu vedanāsu tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas bhava rāga anusaya
translated: From the abandoning of the fetter of uncertainty does he abandon the fetter of existence?

original: parijānāti. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti bhavarāgānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca parijānāti bhava rāga anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: In the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element he abandons the fetter of uncertainty but he does not abandon the fetter of existence. In the fine-material and immaterial elements he abandons the fetter of uncertainty and he abandons the fetter of existence.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or from the abandoning of the fetter of existence does he abandon the fetter of uncertainty? He abandons it.

original: Yato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā  yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: From the abandoning of the fetter of uncertainty does he abandon the fetter of ignorance? He abandons it.🔽Or from the abandoning of the fetter of ignorance does he abandon the fetter of uncertainty? He abandons it.

original: Yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas avijja anusayam parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: From the abandoning of the fetter of existence does he abandon the fetter of ignorance? He abandons it.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti  kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas bhava rāga anusaya
translated: Or alternatively, when he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for becoming?

original: parijānāti. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayañca parijānāti bhavarāgānusayañca
analyzed: parijānāti rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas avijja anusayam ca parijānāti bhava rāga anusayam ca
translated: In the case of the three kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance there but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for becoming there. In the case of the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he fully understands both the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust for becoming there.

original: parijānāti. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: parijānāti ekamūlaka
translated: (One root.)

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit? There is none.

analyzed: yatas vā pana māna anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti iti  rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas māna anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca  paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas māna anusayam ca kāma rāga anusayam ca
translated: Or alternatively, when he fully understands the underlying tendency to conceit, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment?

original: parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti
translated: In the case of the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he fully understands the underlying tendency to conceit there but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment there. In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, he fully understands the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resentment there.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to lust for existence … the underlying tendency to conceit about existence … the underlying tendency to sensual desire … the underlying tendency to resistance … the underlying tendency to uncertainty? No.

analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti iti

analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca  paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca  kāma rāga anusayam ca parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty in them, but not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation.🔽When one fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust in the two kinds of feeling in the sensual realm, one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust in them, but not the underlying tendency to irritation.

original: tato vicikicchānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti.
analyzed: tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to irritation in painful feeling, one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to irritation in it, but not the underlying tendency to lust.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence? No.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti iti no
translated: Or alternatively, when he fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for being, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment? No.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance? No.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: Or alternatively, when he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca🔽paṭighānusayañca parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca🔽parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca  paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas avijja anusayam ca kāma rāga anusayam ca  parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayam ca
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance but not the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment.🔽When he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, he thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires but not the underlying tendency to resentment.

original: paṭighānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to resentment in painful feeling, he thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to resentment but not the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires.🔽(The root text is to be elaborated according to the method of the “pairings” in §195.)

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to irritation, and the underlying tendency to conceit, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to doubt? None.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to irritation, and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti, no ca🔽tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato🔽vicikicchānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti no ca  tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tatas  vicikicchā anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusaya
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to conceit in those dhammas,🔽but one does not thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation in those dhammas. When one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to lust in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere,

original: parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato vicikicchānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti,🔽no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya tatas vicikicchā anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca parijānāti 🔽no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca parijānāti
translated: one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit in those feelings, but one does not thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to irritation in those feelings. When one fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to irritation in painful feeling,🔽one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to irritation and the underlying tendency to conceit in that feeling, but one does not thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to lust in that feeling.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation and the underlying tendency to conceit, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence? No.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: Or when one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for existence, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato bhavarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas bhava rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca parijānāti
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for existence in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to conceit, but not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation and the underlying tendency to conceit, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance? No.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: Or when one fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, does one thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti no ca tatas
translated: When one fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, one thereby fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit, but not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation.

original: kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas avijja anusayañca
translated: He understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation that relate to the first two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere.🔽He understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust, and the underlying tendency to conceit that relate to the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere,

original: kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti
translated: but he does not understand the underlying tendency to irritation that relates to them.🔽He understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to irritation that relate to painful feeling,

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca
translated: but he does not understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit that relate to it.

original: mānānusayañca parijānāti. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: māna anusayam ca parijānāti tikamūlaka
translated: From the triple root.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: “When someone understands the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to irritation, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views, does he thereby understand the underlying tendency to uncertainty?” There is no such case.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: “When someone understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does he thereby understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to irritation, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views?”

analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca parijānāti
translated: He understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views that relate to the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,

analyzed: no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu

analyzed: tatas vicikicchā anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca parijānāti
translated: he fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty,

original: no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato vicikicchānusayañca🔽paṭighānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca
analyzed: no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca  paṭigha anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca
translated: but he does not yet fully understand the underlying tendency to resentment. In painful feeling

original: parijānāti …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: parijānāti  yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: he fully understands the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to views, but he does not yet fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit. …🔽(The fourfold section.)🔽When someone fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to passion for becoming? There is no such case.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: Or when someone fully understands the underlying tendency to passion for becoming, does he thereby fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato bhavarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas bhava rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca parijānāti
translated: He fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment in them.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: When he fully understands the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt, does he then fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance? There is none.

translated: Or when he fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he then fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt?

translated: He fully understands the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment in them. In the sense sphere

translated: In two feelings he fully understands ignorance-proclivity, sensuality-proclivity, conceit-proclivity, views-proclivity,

analyzed: tatas avijjā anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca parijānāti
translated: he fully understands ignorance-proclivity, resentment-proclivity, views-proclivity, uncertainty-proclivity,

analyzed: no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti pañcaka mūlaka  yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayam ca parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: but he does not fully understand sensuality-proclivity and conceit-proclivity. (Fivefold.)🔽“When someone fully understands sensuality-proclivity, resentment-proclivity, conceit-proclivity, views-proclivity, uncertainty-proclivity, and desire-for-existence-proclivity, does he thereby fully understand ignorance-proclivity?” “No.”

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayam ca parijānāti iti
translated: “When someone fully understands ignorance-proclivity, does he thereby fully understand sensuality-proclivity, resentment-proclivity, conceit-proclivity, views-proclivity, uncertainty-proclivity, and desire-for-existence-proclivity?”

analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas he understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty,

analyzed: bhava rāga anusayam ca parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti
translated: but he does not understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment.

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca
analyzed: kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas avijja anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sensual-desire element he understands the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views,

original: vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca parijānāti.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayañca parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayañca bhava rāga anusayañca parijānāti

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca paṭighānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca

analyzed: parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca bhava rāga anusayañca parijānāti chakkamūlaka  anuloma puggala ukāsa
translated: but he does not understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to lust.🔽… He understands the underlying tendency to lust in one who is lusting,

analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: but he does not understand the underlying tendency to resentment in one who is hating.

original: Yo vā pana yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to resistance have completely understood the underlying tendency to lust?🔽No.

analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no  yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures have completely understood the underlying tendency to lust for existence? No.🔽Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to lust for existence have completely understood the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures? No.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures have completely understood the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ parijānāti.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham parijānāti
translated: He has completely understood that which is united with that.

original: Yo vā pana yato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to ignorance have completely understood the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures? No.

original: Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to resentment have completely understood the underlying tendency to conceit? No.

original: Yo vā pana yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas māna anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to conceit have completely understood the underlying tendency to resentment? No.

original: Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to resentment have completely understood the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to doubt? No.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to doubt have completely understood the underlying tendency to resentment?

original: Aṭṭhamako kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ🔽parijānāti, no ca so tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya
analyzed: aṭṭhamako kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tatas vicikicchā anusaya  parijānāti no ca so tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: One who does so in the sense-desire element and in two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that,🔽but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment in regard to that.

original: so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti, paṭighānusayaṁ tadekaṭṭhaṁ parijānāti.🔽Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti paṭigha anusayam tad ekaṭṭham parijānāti  yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti no  yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: That same person in painful feeling abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that, and he abandons the underlying tendency to resentment in regard to that.🔽Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resentment in regard to any state also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure in regard to that state? No.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure in regard to any state also abandon the underlying tendency to resentment in regard to that state? No.

original: Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas avijja anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resentment in regard to any state also abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that state?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ parijānāti.🔽Yo vā pana yato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato paṭighānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham parijānāti  yaḥ vā pana yatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that in the same way.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to any state also abandon the underlying tendency to resentment in regard to that state? No.

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas māna anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to any state also abandon the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that state? No.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or does anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that also have fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that?

original: Aṭṭhamako dukkhāya vedanāya so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca so tato mānānusayaṁ🔽parijānāti. Sveva puggalo kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so
analyzed: aṭṭhamako dukkhāya vedanāya so tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti no ca so tatas māna anusaya  parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ
translated: One on the eighth path of arahantship, in painful feeling, has fully understood the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that, but he has not fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that.

original: tato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti, mānānusayaṁ tadekaṭṭhaṁ parijānāti.
analyzed: tatas vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti māna anusayam tad ekaṭṭham parijānāti
translated: That same person, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of feeling, has fully understood the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that, and he has fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit that is bound up with that.

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas māna anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti
translated: Or does anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that also have fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for being in regard to that?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu so tato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti, no ca

translated: One possessed of the path of stream-entry, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, has fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that, but he has not fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for being in regard to that.

original: so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti. Sveva puggalo rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato🔽mānānusayañca parijānāti bhavarāgānusayañca parijānāti.

translated: That same person, in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of feeling, has fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that and he has fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for being in regard to that.

original: Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yo yato mānānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Āmantā.

translated: Or does anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for being also fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit?🔽Anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit has not necessarily fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for being.🔽But anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for being has fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit.🔽Or does anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for existence also fully understood the underlying tendency to conceit?

analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: Does anyone who has fully understood the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to hate in regard to that also have fully understood the underlying tendency to lust for existence in regard to that? None.

original: Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānātīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti iti no

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca parijānāti saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: Does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendencies to lust and to resentment completely understand the underlying tendency to ignorance? There is no one.

original: Yo vā pana yato avijjānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānātīti? No. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)

translated: Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to ignorance completely understand the underlying tendencies to lust and to resentment? No. (The root text is to be expanded as in the case of the three roots.)

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānāti so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānātīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca parijānāti saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam parijānāti iti natthi
translated: Does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendencies to lust and to resentment and to conceit completely understand the underlying tendencies to views … to uncertainty …? There is no one.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca parijānātīti?

translated: Or does anyone who has completely understood the underlying tendency to uncertainty completely understand the underlying tendencies to lust and to resentment and to conceit?

original: Aṭṭhamako rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato vicikicchānusayañca parijānāti mānānusayañca

original: tadekaṭṭhaṁ parijānāti, no ca so tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca parijānāti.
