translated: and the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, and the underlying tendency to passion for becoming,

original: na parijānāti, no ca so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ
analyzed: na parijānāti no ca saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion.

original: maggasamaṅgīnañca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā avijjānusayañca na parijānanti
analyzed: magga samaṅgīnañca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalāḥ avijjā anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: Except for those who are partaking of the Noble Path and the eighth person, the remaining persons do not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance

original: kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty,

original: bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānanti. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti chakkamūlaka
translated: and the underlying tendency to passion for becoming. (The six-factored wheel.)

original: 7.2.4.5. Paṭilomaokāsa
analyzed: paṭiloma okāsa
translated: .... The reverse order

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: From the time that he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, from that time he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to aversion?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ na
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam na
translated: In painful feeling, from that time he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to aversion.

original: parijānāti. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti🔽paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti rūpadhātuyā a rūpadhātuyā a pariyāpanne tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti 🔽paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the element of form, in the formless element, in what is not included, from that time he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion.

original: Yato vā pana paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ🔽na parijānāti. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne tato paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: yatas vā pana paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti  kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusaya  na parijānāti rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā a pariyāpanne tatas paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust?🔽In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance there but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust there.

original: kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres and in the supramundane, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance there and he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust there.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato mānānusayaṁ🔽na parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti  rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas māna anusaya  na parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: When he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit?🔽In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust there but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit there.

original: mānānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the case of painful feeling and in the supramundane, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust there and he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit there.

original: Yato vā pana mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana māna anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust?

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti  dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti no
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to lust for existence … the underlying tendency to ignorance?”🔽“When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for material form and immaterial form?

original: ca tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti🔽vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: ca tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti  vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial?

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial?

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti  rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas bhava rāga anusaya
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial?🔽“When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial?🔽“When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial?

original: na parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti🔽bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: na parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti 🔽bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial?

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or alternatively, from the non-penetration of the underlying tendency to lust for being, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ
analyzed: kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas kāma rāga anusaya
translated: In the sense-desire element in the two kinds of feeling, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for being there, but he does penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there.

original: na parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: na parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya a pariyāpanne tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In painful feeling, in the inconstant, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for being there,

original: kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: nor does he penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas avijja anusayam na parijānāti iti  dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti no
translated: From the non-penetration of the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to ignorance?🔽In painful feeling, in the form element, in the formless element, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there, but he does penetrate the underlying tendency to ignorance there.

original: ca tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: ca tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the inconstant, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there,

original: avijjānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: na parijānāti
translated: nor does he penetrate the underlying tendency to ignorance there.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or alternatively, from the non-penetration of the underlying tendency to ignorance, he does not penetrate the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires?

original: Yato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti,
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti
translated: In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material sphere and in the immaterial sphere, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance,

original: no ca tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: no ca tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: but one does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit. In the case of the unincluded, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance

original: mānānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yato vā pana mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana māna anusayam na parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or when one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato mānānusayañca na parijānāti paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas māna anusayam ca na parijānāti paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the case of painful feeling, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, but one does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance. In the case of the unincluded, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit🔽and the underlying tendency to resistance.

original: Yato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to doubt?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti,
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti
translated: In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material sphere and in the immaterial sphere, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance,

original: no ca tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato paṭighānusayañca na
analyzed: no ca tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas paṭigha anusayam ca na
translated: but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to uncertainty that has not already been abandoned. In what is not included, the underlying tendency to resistance that has not already been abandoned,

original: parijānāti vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: but he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to doubt that has that as its object. In the inconstant, he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object and he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to doubt that has that as its object.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to doubt that has that as its object, he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object.

original: Yato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ
analyzed: yatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti  rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas bhava rāga anusaya
translated: When he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object, does he not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for non-existence that has that as its object?

original: na parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne tato paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti🔽bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: na parijānāti kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne tatas paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti  bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object, but he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for non-existence that has that as its object. In the inconstant, he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object and he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for non-existence that has that as its object.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for non-existence that has that as its object, does he not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas paṭigha anusaya
translated: In painful feeling, he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for non-existence that has that as its object, but he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resentment that has that as its object.

original: na parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne tato bhavarāgānusayañca na
analyzed: na parijānāti kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu a pariyāpanne tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na
translated: he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust.

original: parijānāti paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: parijānāti paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere that are not included in the first two kinds of feeling, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resistance.

original: Yato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti tatas avijja anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: “When he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance?”

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti,🔽no ca tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti  no ca tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance,

original: avijjānusayañca na parijānāti.🔽Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: na parijānāti  yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance. In the kinds of becoming that are not included in the first two kinds of becoming, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to ignorance.🔽“When he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to resistance?”

original: Yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: “When he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to uncertainty?”

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato mānānusayañca na parijānāti vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas māna anusayam ca na parijānāti vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in painful feeling, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism in pleasant feeling. He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in the neutral feeling of the fine-material sphere, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism in the neutral feeling of the immaterial sphere.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā  yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or alternatively, where he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit there.🔽Where he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence there?

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato mānānusayaṁ🔽na parijānāti. Dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti  dvīsu vedanāsu tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas māna anusaya  na parijānāti dukkhāya vedanāya a pariyāpanne tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: Where he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit there?🔽He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in painful feeling.

original: mānānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in the neutral feeling of the immaterial sphere, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in the neutral feeling of the fine-material sphere.

original: Yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Where he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance there?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato mānānusayañca na parijānāti avijjānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti apariyāpanne tatas māna anusayam ca na parijānāti avijjā anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in relation to painful feeling, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance in relation to it. He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in relation to the unincluded, nor does he fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance in relation to it.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance in relation to the unincluded, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in relation to it.

original: Yato diṭṭhānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas diṭṭha anusayam na parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to false view in relation to the unincluded, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to doubt in relation to it.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti tatas diṭṭha anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā pe
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to doubt in relation to the unincluded, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to false view in relation to it.

original: Yato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to doubt in relation to the unincluded, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in relation to it.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or alternatively, when he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in relation to the unincluded, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to doubt in relation to it.

original: Kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato vicikicchānusayaṁ
analyzed: tīsu vedanāsu tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas vicikicchā anusaya
translated: He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in relation to the three kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to doubt in relation to them.

original: na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti.🔽Yato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: na parijānāti a pariyāpanne tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti  yatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being.🔽When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being?

original: Yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas avijja anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca tato avijjānusayaṁ
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca tatas avijjā anusaya
translated: In the case of the three kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, when one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance.

original: na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti avijjānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: na parijānāti a pariyāpanne tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti avijjā anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: But when one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā ekamūlaka
translated: When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit?

analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti  rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca na parijānāti no
translated: When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit?🔽When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,

original: ca tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Apariyāpanne tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca
analyzed: ca tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti a pariyāpanne tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca
translated: one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in those dhammas. When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to irritation in the imperturbable,

analyzed: na parijānāti māna anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in the imperturbable.

original: Yato vā pana mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānātīti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya tato mānānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti, no ca tato
analyzed: yatas vā pana māna anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti iti  dukkhāya vedanāya tatas māna anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca na parijānāti no ca tatas

translated: one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to irritation in the imperturbable.

translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion, does one not fully understand the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to doubt?”

translated: “When one does not fully understand the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion pertaining to them.🔽But when one does not fully understand the unincluded dhammas, one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion pertaining to them, nor does one fully understand the underlying tendency to doubt pertaining to them.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānātīti? Āmantā.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti iti
translated: Or else, when he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being, he does not fully understand the underlying tendencies to lust for sensual desires, to resistance, to conceit, to views, and to uncertainty.

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato bhavarāgānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca na parijānāti,
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas bhava rāga anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca na parijānāti
translated: With painful feeling, he does not fully understand the underlying tendencies to lust for being and to lust for sensual desires, and to conceit,

original: no ca tato paṭighānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti. Kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: no ca tatas paṭigha anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānāti kāmadhātuyā
translated: but he does not fully understand the underlying tendencies to resistance, to views, and to uncertainty. In the sense sphere

original: dvīsu vedanāsu tato bhavarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti, no ca tato🔽kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti.🔽Apariyāpanne tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu tatas bhava rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca na parijānāti no ca tatas  kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānāti  a pariyāpanne tatas bhava rāga anusayañca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca
translated: with the two kinds of feeling, he does not fully understand the underlying tendencies to lust for being and to resistance,🔽but he does not fully understand the underlying tendencies to lust for sensual desires, to conceit, to views, and to uncertainty.

original: mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānāti
translated: With the unincluded, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being, and he does not fully understand the underlying tendencies to lust for sensual desires, to resistance, to conceit, to views, and to uncertainty.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānātīti? Āmantā. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā  yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti iti āmantā pañcakamūlaka
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt, does one then not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance?” “Yes.”🔽“When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance, does one then not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt?” “Yes.”

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.🔽Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā  yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam na parijānāti tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to desire for being, does one then not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance?” “Yes.”

original: mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānātīti?
analyzed: māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca bhava rāga anusayañca na parijānāti iti
translated: “When one does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance, does one then not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to desire for being?”

original: Āmantā. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: āmantā chakkamūlaka
translated: “Yes.”

original: 7.2.4.6. Paṭilomapuggalokāsa
analyzed: paṭiloma puggala ukāsa
translated: 7.2.4.6. The reverse order of persons and faculties

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca🔽so tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti iti  anāgāmi magga samaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti no ca  saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā a pariyāpanne
translated: Does anyone who does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures with regard to anything not fully understand the underlying tendency to aversion with regard to that?

original: so tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti. Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgiṁ
analyzed: saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti anāgāmi magga samaṅgi
translated: One who possesses the path of non-return does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures with regard to painful feeling, but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to aversion with regard to that. That same person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures and the underlying tendency to aversion with regard to the element of form, the element of formlessness, and the unincluded.

original: ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti paṭighānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāma rāga anusayañca na parijānanti paṭigha anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: Excepting one who possesses the path of non-return, the rest of the persons do not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures and the underlying tendency to aversion with regard to all.

original: Yo vā pana yato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or does anyone who does not fully understand the underlying tendency to aversion with regard to anything not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures with regard to that?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu so tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānāti,
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti
translated: One who possesses the path of non-return does not fully understand the underlying tendency to aversion with regard to the element of sensual desire and the two kinds of feeling.

original: no ca so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
analyzed: no ca saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
translated: but he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there.

original: apariyāpanne so tato paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti.🔽Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgiṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha paṭighānusayañca na parijānanti
analyzed: a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti  anāgāmi magga samaṅgim ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: This person does not completely understand the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there.

original: kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: Except for one who possesses the path of non-return, all other persons do not completely understand the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ🔽na parijānāti, no ca so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti  agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusaya  na parijānāti no ca so tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: One who does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires there does not completely understand the underlying tendency to conceit there?🔽One who possesses the path of stream-entry does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in the sense-desire element and in two of the feelings in the fine-material element and in the immaterial element,

original: apariyāpanne so tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti mānānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayañca na parijānāti māna anusayañca na parijānāti
translated: but he does not completely understand the underlying tendency to conceit there. This person does not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit there.

original: Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti
analyzed: dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: Except for two persons possessed of the paths, the rest do not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: mānānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit in all cases.

original: Yo vā pana yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, if anyone does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to any given state, does he not also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to that state?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti,🔽no ca so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti  no ca so tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā
translated: One who is possessed of the path of non-return does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere,

original: arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne so tato mānānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca na
analyzed: arūpadhātuyāḥ a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas māna anusayam ca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca na
translated: but he does not not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to them. The same person does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to painful feeling in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,🔽and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to the unincluded dhammas. Except for two persons possessed of the paths, the rest do not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit

original: parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha mānānusayañca🔽na parijānanti kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: parijānāti dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha māna anusayam ca  na parijānanti kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in all cases.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: If anyone does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to any given state, does he not also abandon the underlying tendency to views, etc., in regard to that state?

original: Aṭṭhamako kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ🔽na parijānāti, no ca so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo apariyāpanne
analyzed: aṭṭhamako kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato kāma rāga anusaya  na parijānāti no ca saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ a pariyāpanne
translated: The eighth person does not fully understand sensual desire and lust for the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, and for the feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements.

original: so tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti. Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgiñca
analyzed: saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayañca na parijānāti vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānāti anāgāmi magga samaṅgiñca
translated: He does not fully understand sensual desire and lust for the unincluded.

original: aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti
analyzed: aṭṭhamakam ca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāma rāga anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: Except for the one who possesses the path of non-return and the eighth person, the remaining persons do not fully understand sensual desire and lust for all.

original: vicikicchānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: They do not fully understand uncertainty for all.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, if someone does not fully understand uncertainty in regard to a certain place, does he not fully understand sensual desire and lust in regard to that place?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti,
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti
translated: The one who possesses the path of non-return does not fully understand uncertainty in regard to the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element,

original: no ca so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: no ca so tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā
translated: but he does not not fully understand sensual desire and lust in regard to that. That same person does not fully understand uncertainty in regard to painful feeling, and in regard to the fine-material and immaterial elements.

original: arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne so tato vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca
analyzed: arūpadhātuyāḥ a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca
translated: in the immaterial world sphere, he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: na parijānāti. Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgiñca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha
analyzed: na parijānāti anāgāmi magga samaṅgiñca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha
translated: . Except for the one who is possessed of the path of non-return and the one who is on the eighth path, the rest of the persons do not fully understand

original: vicikicchānusayañca na parijānanti kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānanti kāma rāga anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in all cases.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: In regard to any given state, if someone does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to that state, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in regard to that state?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti,🔽no ca so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: agga magga samaṅgī rūpadhātuyā a rūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti  no ca saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu
translated: One who is possessed of the path of stream-entry does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to the fine-material and immaterial world spheres,

original: apariyāpanne so tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti
translated: but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for existence in regard to them. That same person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to lust for existence in regard to the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire world sphere🔽and in the immaterial world sphere.

original: Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti
analyzed: dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: Except for the two kinds of persons who are possessed of the paths, the rest of the persons do not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to lust for existence in all cases.

original: bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: nor do they completely understand the underlying tendency to delight in existence.

original: Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, if anyone does not completely understand the underlying tendency to delight in existence in regard to any given state, does he not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to that state?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti,🔽no ca so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā🔽arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne so tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti  no ca so tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā  arūpadhātuyāḥ a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca
translated: One who possesses the path of non-return does not completely understand the underlying tendency to delight in existence in regard to the sensual-desire element and in two of the feelings,🔽but he does not not completely understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to them. That same person does not completely understand the underlying tendency to delight in existence and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: na parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha bhavarāgānusayañca
analyzed: na parijānāti dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha bhava rāga anusayam ca
translated: in regard to the painful feeling in the fine-material and immaterial elements and in the unincluded. Those in training, except for the two mentioned, do not completely understand the underlying tendency to delight in existence

analyzed: na parijānanti kāma rāga anusayam ca na parijānanti

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?

analyzed: agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusaya

original: na parijānāti, no ca so tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo apariyāpanne
analyzed: na parijānāti no ca saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ a pariyāpanne

original: so tato kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānāti avijjānusayañca na parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ

translated: This person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to ignorance.🔽Except for two persons who possess the path,

analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, if someone does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to a certain state, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in regard to that state?

analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti  no ca so tatas kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā

original: arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne so tato avijjānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca
analyzed: arūpadhātuyāḥ a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam ca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca

original: na parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha avijjānusayañca
analyzed: na parijānāti dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha avijjā anusayam ca

original: na parijānanti kāmarāgānusayañca na parijānanti.

translated: Except for those in training who are possessed of the path, all other persons do not yet fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure.

analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti  agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas paṭigha anusaya

original: Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha paṭighānusayañca na parijānanti🔽mānānusayañca na parijānanti.

translated: Except for those in training who are possessed of the path, all other persons do not yet fully understand the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit as found in the inconstant element.

original: Yo vā pana yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato paṭighānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?

This same person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere,

original: arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne so tato mānānusayañca na parijānāti paṭighānusayañca na🔽parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha mānānusayañca
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyāḥ a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas māna anusayam ca na parijānāti paṭigha anusayam ca na  parijānāti dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha māna anusayam ca

analyzed: aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha māna anusayañca na parijānanti vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: The eighth person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the form and formless elements, but he does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism in these. The same person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to scepticism in the imperturbable. Except for the one who possesses the path of stream-entry, the remaining persons do not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to scepticism in all these.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti  agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusaya
translated: Or, if someone does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism in regard to a certain state, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in that?

original: na parijānāti, no ca so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya
analyzed: na parijānāti no ca so tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: The one who possesses the path of stream-entry does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism in the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the form and formless elements, but he does not not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in these. The same person does not fully understand the underlying tendency to scepticism in painful feeling,

original: apariyāpanne so tato vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti mānānusayañca na parijānāti.🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgiñca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti māna anusayam ca na parijānāti  agga magga samaṅgiñca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: in the immaterial states he does not abandon the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: na parijānanti mānānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: na parijānanti māna anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: Except for the one who possesses the path of stream-entry and the one who is on the path of once-return, the remaining persons do not abandon the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to conceit in any of the three planes.

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: As to the question whether someone who does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to a certain plane also does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for being in that plane, the answer is:

original: Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, as to the question whether someone who does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for being in a certain plane also does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in that plane, the answer is:

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti,
analyzed: agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti
translated: The one who possesses the path of stream-entry does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for being in the sense-desire element and in two of the planes of existence,

original: no ca so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne
analyzed: no ca saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in any of the three planes. The same person in painful feeling and in the immaterial states

original: so tato bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānāti mānānusayañca na parijānāti. Aggamaggasamaṅgiṁ
analyzed: saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti māna anusayam ca na parijānāti agga magga samaṅgi
translated: does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for being and the underlying tendency to conceit. The one who possesses the path of stream-entry

original: ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānanti mānānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha bhava rāga anusayañca na parijānanti māna anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: Apart from the above cases, the rest do not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānāti, no ca so tato🔽avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo apariyāpanne so tato mānānusayañca na🔽parijānāti avijjānusayañca na parijānāti. Aggamaggasamaṅgiṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā
analyzed: yaḥ yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti iti  agga magga samaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti no ca saḥ tatas  avijjā anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ apariyāpanne saḥ tatas māna anusayam ca na  parijānāti avijjā anusayam ca na parijānāti agga magga samaṅgim ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā
translated: Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to anything?

original: sabbattha mānānusayañca na parijānanti avijjānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: sabbattha māna anusayañca na parijānanti avijjā anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: One possessing the path of Stream-Entry does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to painful feeling, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to it. That same person does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to the unincluded. Apart from those possessing the path of Stream-Entry, the rest do not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to anything.🔽Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to anything?

original: Yo vā pana yato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato mānānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas avijjā anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to anything?🔽Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to anything?

original: Yo yato diṭṭhānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.

translated: Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to anything?🔽Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to anything?🔽Does anyone not abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to anything?

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam na parijānāti iti āmantā pe
translated: Or does anyone who does not thoroughly know the underlying tendency to uncertainty about one thing not thoroughly know the underlying tendency to wrong view about that?🔽He does not thoroughly know the underlying tendency to uncertainty about that, but he does thoroughly know the underlying tendency to wrong view about that.

original: Yo yato vicikicchānusayaṁ na parijānāti so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti iti

analyzed: a pariyāpanne saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti bhava rāga anusayam ca na parijānāti  agga magga samaṅgiñca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha vicikicchā anusayañca

original: na parijānanti bhavarāgānusayañca na parijānanti.

analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam na parijānāti iti

analyzed: vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānanti
translated: Except for the one who possesses the path of stream-entry and the eighth person, the remaining persons do not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to uncertainty in all.

analyzed: saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca na parijānāti avijjā anusayam ca na parijānāti agga magga samaṅgiñca  aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha vicikicchā anusayañca na parijānanti
translated: He does not fully understand the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to ignorance.🔽Except for the one who is possessed of the path of stream-entry and the one who is on the plane of the ordinary person,

translated: Or does anyone who does not fully understand the underlying tendency to ignorance not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for being?🔽(The method of exposition is to be continued up to the third dyad in the same way as in the first triad.)

analyzed: agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca

analyzed: paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti no ca saḥ tatas māna anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ

original: kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānanti mānānusayañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca na parijānanti māna anusayañca na parijānanti

analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas māna anusayam na parijānāti saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, if someone does not fully understand the underlying tendency to conceit in any given case, does he not fully understand the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment in that case too?

analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya saḥ tatas māna anusayam ca kāma rāga anusayam ca na

analyzed: parijānāti no ca so tatas paṭigha anusayam na parijānāti su eva puggalaḥ kāmadhātuyā
translated: This person in the sense-desire element

original: dvīsu vedanāsu so tato mānānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti, no ca so tato
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas māna anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca na parijānāti no ca saḥ tatas

original: kāmarāgānusayaṁ na parijānāti. Sveva puggalo rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam na parijānāti svā iva puggalaḥ rūpadhātuyā a rūpadhātuyā a pariyāpanne
translated: This person in the form element and formless element, not included in the inconstant,

original: so tato mānānusayañca na parijānāti kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānāti.
analyzed: saḥ tatas māna anusayam ca na parijānāti kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca na parijānāti

original: Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnaṁ ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha mānānusayañca na parijānanti
analyzed: dvinnam magga samaṅgīnam ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha māna anusayam ca na parijānanti

original: kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca na parijānanti.

original: na parijānāti. Dvinnaṁ maggasamaṅgīnañca aṭṭhamakañca ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā sabbattha

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca na parijānāti so tato avijjānusayaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya so tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca
